metadata.synopsis: Post EA dialog version.Initial dialogue with Wyll. In most cases, this will involve him training a tiefling child before the player breaks in, and you discover you were both on the mind flayer ship. Wyll comes across as a big-time hero, and wants help killing goblins. He is called the Blade of Frontiers by most.

10.speaker: Narrator
10.text: *The man's face falls as recognition sets in. He knows you, and you know him: the so-called hero known as the Blade of Frontiers, hunter of monsters - and devils.*
10.context: NodeContext: Wyll holding is holding a sword with his RIGHT hand.

53.speaker: Narrator
53.text: *Your minds become one. The man sees a familiar figure in your thoughts: red skin, curled horn. Karlach.*
53.context: NodeContext: Wyll holding is holding a sword with his RIGHT hand.

123.speaker: Wyll
123.text: It's Karlach I want. I'll be waiting.
123.context: NodeContext: Wyll holding is holding a sword with his RIGHT hand.

149.speaker: Wyll
149.text: Go on. Give me your best shot.
149.context: NodeContext: Wyll holding is holding a sword with his RIGHT hand.

146.context: CinematicNodeContext: Kid swings his play sword and spins around in a funny way.

263.speaker: Umi
263.context: NodeContext: Cries out while swinging a sword

240.speaker: Wyll
240.context: NodeContext: Wyll holding is holding a sword with his RIGHT hand.

132.text: I can't do it. I'm not like you.
132.context: CinematicNodeContext: He thrusts even harder. He parries and lightly hits her. She'd be dead if this was real

20.speaker: Umi
20.text: I can't do it. I'm not like you.
20.context: CinematicNodeContext: Wyll crouches and brings himself to Umi's eye levelNodeContext: Wyll holding is holding a sword with his RIGHT hand.

50.speaker: Wyll
50.text: Umi. I don't need you to be like me.
50.context: CinematicNodeContext: Wyll crouches and brings himself to Umi's eye levelNodeContext: Wyll holding is holding a sword with his RIGHT hand.

258.text: You just have to buy enough time to -
258.context: CinematicNodeContext: Wyll rises out of crouching position at end of the line. He was interrupted by a familiar face.

97.speaker: Wyll
97.text: You just have to buy enough time to -
97.context: CinematicNodeContext: Wyll rises out of crouching position at end of the line. He was interrupted by a familiar face.

273.speaker: Wyll
273.text: You just have to buy enough time to run. Come on. I believe in you. You can do this.
273.context: CinematicNodeContext: Wyll rises out of crouching position at end of the line.

83.text: Hey there. Can I have a word?
83.context: CinematicNodeContext: Wyll turns to you, smiling.

236.speaker: Player
236.text: Hey there. Can I have a word?
236.context: CinematicNodeContext: Wyll turns to you, smiling.

3.text: Well met. The Blade of Frontiers at your -
3.context: CinematicNodeContext: Wyll turns to you, smiling.

212.speaker: Wyll
212.text: Well met. The Blade of Frontiers at your -
212.context: NodeContext: Astarion speaking to the companion origin character that's replacing him in the party. "Them" refers to the player's avatar characer.

222.speaker: Narrator
222.text: *The man's eyes fall on you and recognition sets in. He knows you, and you know him: the so-called hero known as the Blade of Frontiers, hunter of monsters - and devils.*
222.context: NodeContext: Astarion speaking to the companion origin character that's replacing him in the party. "Them" refers to the player's avatar characer.

254.speaker: Narrator
254.text: *His thoughts become yours. You are the Blade of Frontiers, racing through the wastes of Avernus after a diabolical figure blazing in flame. Racing after you.*

54.speaker: Player
54.text: Fuck's sake. You have to let this chase go. I'm not who you think I am.

188.speaker: Wyll
188.text: I am the Blade. I will chase my prey until death takes me.

168.speaker: Player
168.text: It's about time we met face-to-face. Nice to meet you at last, Wyll.

48.speaker: Wyll
48.text: Don't act like we're friends, devil. I know what you are. I know who you serve.

72.speaker: Wyll
72.text: And I know the Coast is in danger as long as you walk it.

264.speaker: Player
264.text: I'm not going to hurt these people. We saved them from goblins together, remember?

118.speaker: Wyll
118.text: Gain their trust now, and prime their souls for the reaping. I know the tricks.

270.speaker: Wyll
270.text: For the sake of these children, I'll stay my blade. Go, enjoy your breaths while you can still take them.

251.speaker: Player
251.text: You still don't get it. I'm running from Zariel, not working for her.

137.speaker: Wyll
137.text: You think I don't know the truth? How your flesh blazes with Avernus' heat? How your axe splits your victims straight down the middle?

41.speaker: Player
41.text: And what do you plan to do about it? Kill me?

105.speaker: Wyll
105.text: Yes - but not here. For the sake of these children, I'll stay my blade.

99.speaker: Wyll
99.text: Go, enjoy every breath while you can still take them.

175.speaker: Wyll
175.text: Trust me - I won't be far behind.

184.speaker: Player
184.text: What do you know. Looks like I'm not the only one who hitched a ride on the nautiloid.

34.speaker: Wyll
34.text: You should have stayed in the Hells, devil.

77.speaker: Wyll
77.text: I know what you are. I know who you serve.

282.speaker: Player
282.text: You followed me all the way here just to find out I'm no devil, you know.

140.speaker: Narrator
140.text: *Your minds become one. The man sees a familiar figure in your thoughts: red skin, curled horn. Karlach.*
140.context: NodeContext: Astarion speaking to the companion origin character that's replacing him in the party. "Them" refers to the player's avatar characer.

139.speaker: Wyll
139.text: Hold your tongue. It's not you I want - it's Karlach. Send her over.

180.speaker: Wyll
180.text: Oh, and a piece of advice: don't play with devils unless you don't mind getting burnt.

106.speaker: Narrator
106.text: *The man's smile bends downward, and his thoughts become yours.*
106.context: NodeContext: Astarion speaking to the companion origin character that's replacing him in the party. "Them" refers to the player's avatar characer.

6.speaker: Narrator
6.text: *You are the Blade of Frontiers, racing through the wastes of Avernus. Just ahead, a diabolical figure - red skin, single curled horn - blazes with flame, bloodied greataxe held high.*
6.context: NodeContext: Astarion speaking to the companion origin character that's replacing him in the party. "Them" refers to the player's avatar characer.

60.speaker: Narrator
60.text: *It's Karlach - the woman you met in the wilds.*
60.context: NodeContext: Astarion speaking to the companion origin character that's replacing him in the party. "Them" refers to the player's avatar characer.

40.speaker: Wyll
40.text: Hells' great fires - you were on the ship.
40.context: NodeContext: Astarion speaking to the companion origin character that's replacing him in the party. "Them" refers to the player's avatar characer.

152.speaker: Player
152.text: Yes - and we both carry parasites.
152.context: NodeContext: Astarion speaking to the companion origin character that's replacing him in the party. "Them" refers to the player's avatar characer.

255.speaker: Wyll
255.text: Mm - doomed to shed our skin and become illithid, or so the stories go.

163.speaker: Player
163.text: Another escapee? Thank the gods - I need all the friends I can get.
163.context: NodeContext: Astarion speaking to the companion origin character that's replacing him in the party. "Them" refers to the player's avatar characer.

238.speaker: Wyll
238.text: Better friends than the ones hitching a ride in our skulls, at least.
238.context: NodeContext: Astarion speaking to the companion origin character that's replacing him in the party. "Them" refers to the player's avatar characer.

216.speaker: Wyll
216.text: I'm sure you know the stories. Doomed to shed our skin and become illithid. They say there's no coming back.
216.context: NodeContext: Astarion speaking to the companion origin character that's replacing him in the party. "Them" refers to the player's avatar characer.

142.speaker: Wyll
142.text: But we haven't sprouted any tentacles - not yet, anyway. Could just be good luck. I'm not so...
142.context: NodeContext: Astarion speaking to the companion origin character that's replacing him in the party. "Them" refers to the player's avatar characer.

81.speaker: Narrator
81.text: *Your minds collide once more. Wyll chases the fiend, ignited with rancour. She is an infernal wardevil, a threat to the living - evil incarnate.*
81.context: NodeContext: Astarion speaking to the companion origin character that's replacing him in the party. "Them" refers to the player's avatar characer.

119.speaker: Wyll
119.text: Shit - you saw her: advocatus diaboli.
119.context: NodeContext: Astarion speaking to the companion origin character that's replacing him in the party. "Them" refers to the player's avatar characer.

244.speaker: Player
244.text: *Advocatus diaboli. A devil's advocate - a champion in the Blood War between diabolical forces and demons.*
244.context: NodeContext: Astarion speaking to the companion origin character that's replacing him in the party. "Them" refers to the player's avatar characer.

179.speaker: Narrator
179.text: *Advocatus diaboli. A devil's advocate - a champion in the Blood War between diabolical forces and demons.*
179.context: NodeContext: Astarion speaking to the companion origin character that's replacing him in the party. "Them" refers to the player's avatar characer.

227.text: *Advocatus diaboli. A devil's advocate - a champion in the Blood War between diabolical forces and demons.*
227.context: NodeContext: Astarion speaking to the companion origin character that's replacing him in the party. "Them" refers to the player's avatar characer.

162.speaker: Narrator
162.text: *Advocatus diaboli. A devil's advocate - a champion in the Blood War between diabolical forces and demons.*
162.context: NodeContext: Astarion speaking to the companion origin character that's replacing him in the party. "Them" refers to the player's avatar characer.

197.speaker: Player
197.text: Also known as Karlach. She's in the wilds, some ways from here.
197.context: NodeContext: Astarion speaking to the companion origin character that's replacing him in the party. "Them" refers to the player's avatar characer.

47.speaker: Wyll
47.text: You met her? Then you were subject to her lies.
47.context: NodeContext: Astarion speaking to the companion origin character that's replacing him in the party. "Them" refers to the player's avatar characer.

78.speaker: Wyll
78.text: Karlach is an archdevil's soldier I swore on my good eye to kill.
78.context: NodeContext: Astarion speaking to the companion origin character that's replacing him in the party. "Them" refers to the player's avatar characer.

206.speaker: Wyll
206.text: I tracked her through the Hells to the mind flayer ship. But the damned illithids infected me before I could end her.
206.context: NodeContext: Astarion speaking to the companion origin character that's replacing him in the party. "Them" refers to the player's avatar characer.

12.speaker: Wyll
12.text: She's out there now, preying on the innocent. I don't kill her, she'll leave behind nothing but a trail of corpses.
12.context: NodeContext: Astarion speaking to the companion origin character that's replacing him in the party. "Them" refers to the player's avatar characer.

207.speaker: Player
207.text: Are you sure? Karlach doesn't seem like some rampaging devil to me.
207.context: NodeContext: Astarion speaking to the companion origin character that's replacing him in the party. "Them" refers to the player's avatar characer.

155.speaker: Wyll
155.text: You met her? So she filled you with lies.

205.speaker: Wyll
205.text: I've seen her myself, tearing through the Hells on behalf of her mistress, Zariel.

44.speaker: Wyll
44.text: We can't leave her be. Who knows how many lives she might take?

249.speaker: Player
249.text: Let's join forces. I'll help you cast this devil back into the Hells.
249.context: NodeContext: Astarion speaking to the companion origin character that's replacing him in the party. "Them" refers to the player's avatar characer.

4.speaker: Player
4.text: I'm looking to cure this infection. I suggest we partner up.
4.context: NodeContext: Astarion speaking to the companion origin character that's replacing him in the party. "Them" refers to the player's avatar characer.

79.speaker: Wyll
79.text: Just so you know, my first duty is Karlach. I'm oathbound to go after her.

5.speaker: Wyll
5.text: But I won't deny this infection is bothersome.

121.speaker: Wyll
121.text: I'll need to talk to your leader if you want to partner up, though.

56.speaker: Wyll
56.text: You'll need to make room if you want to partner up, though.

281.speaker: Wyll
281.text: Besides, I watched you at the gate. I could use an ally like you.

18.speaker: Player
18.text: You have a mind flayer tadpole in your head. Doesn't that worry you?
18.context: NodeContext: Astarion speaking to the companion origin character that's replacing him in the party. "Them" refers to the player's avatar characer.

262.speaker: Wyll
262.text: I'd be a fool if it didn't. I know the stories - doomed to shed my skin, become illithid. And there's no coming back.
262.context: NodeContext: Astarion speaking to the companion origin character that's replacing him in the party. "Them" refers to the player's avatar characer.

65.speaker: Wyll
65.text: But I haven't sprouted any tentacles - least not yet, thank Balduran.
65.context: NodeContext: Astarion speaking to the companion origin character that's replacing him in the party. "Them" refers to the player's avatar characer.

261.speaker: Wyll
261.text: Could just be good luck. But sooner or later, it's bound to run out.
261.context: NodeContext: Astarion speaking to the companion origin character that's replacing him in the party. "Them" refers to the player's avatar characer.

239.speaker: Player
239.text: Join me, then. We'll search for a cure.
239.context: NodeContext: Astarion speaking to the companion origin character that's replacing him in the party. "Them" refers to the player's avatar characer.

159.speaker: Player
159.text: Chk - a worthy ally, perhaps. But I'll waste no time chasing devils while a tadpole feasts on our skulls.
159.context: NodeContext: Astarion speaking to the companion origin character that's replacing him in the party. "Them" refers to the player's avatar characer.

177.speaker: Lae'zel
177.text: Chk - a worthy ally, perhaps. But I'll waste no time chasing devils while a tadpole feasts on our skulls.
177.context: NodeContext: Astarion speaking to the companion origin character that's replacing him in the party. "Them" refers to the player's avatar characer.

215.speaker: Player
215.text: Trust me, gith - I know the stories. Doomed to shed our skin and become illithid. And they say there's no coming back.
215.context: NodeContext: Astarion speaking to the companion origin character that's replacing him in the party. "Them" refers to the player's avatar characer.

234.speaker: Wyll
234.text: Trust me, gith - I know the stories. Doomed to shed our skin and become illithid. And they say there's no coming back.
234.context: NodeContext: Astarion speaking to the companion origin character that's replacing him in the party. "Them" refers to the player's avatar characer.

24.speaker: Wyll
24.text: But I've seen your people in battle. I reckon you are no mere warrior, but a godsdamned army. If anyone can overcome this tadpole, it's you.

267.speaker: Wyll
267.text: I'd be a fool to let you turn your back. Pledge me your talents, and I'll pledge you mine.

129.speaker: Wyll
129.text: I'll presume that's githyanki for 'yes'. Now let's move.

124.speaker: Player
124.text: Hmph - the famous Blade of Frontiers, in the flesh. Clever, this hero act you've got going.

250.speaker: Player
250.text: Hmph - the famous Blade of Frontiers, in the flesh. Clever, this hero act you've got going.

260.speaker: Shadowheart
260.text: Hmph - the famous Blade of Frontiers, in the flesh. Clever, this hero act you've got going.

228.speaker: Player
228.text: 'Hero', 'Blade' - names strangers gave me. My friends call me 'Wyll'.

31.speaker: Wyll
31.text: 'Hero', 'Blade' - names strangers gave me. My friends call me 'Wyll'.

82.speaker: Player
82.text: Excellent. If we ever become friends, I'll know what to call you.

157.speaker: Shadowheart
157.text: Excellent. If we ever become friends, I'll know what to call you.

68.speaker: Player
68.text: Oh my. This is going to be a fun journey.

128.speaker: Player
128.text: Oh my. This is going to be a fun journey.

43.speaker: Astarion
43.text: Oh my. This is going to be a fun journey.

134.speaker: Wyll
134.text: I've seen your people in battle. I reckon you are no mere warrior, but a godsdamned army.
134.context: NodeContext: Astarion speaking to the companion origin character that's replacing him in the party. "Them" refers to the player's avatar characer.

191.speaker: Wyll
191.text: I'd welcome the company - but your leader should make the decision.
191.context: NodeContext: Astarion speaking to the companion origin character that's replacing him in the party. "Them" refers to the player's avatar characer.

272.speaker: Wyll
272.text: I'd love to join - but I don't think there's enough space for me to squeeze in.
272.context: NodeContext: Astarion speaking to the companion origin character that's replacing him in the party. "Them" refers to the player's avatar characer.

100.speaker: Wyll
100.text: I'm up for the challenge. You've just got to make a little space.
100.context: NodeContext: Astarion speaking to the companion origin character that's replacing him in the party. "Them" refers to the player's avatar characer.

187.speaker: Player
187.text: All right. Meet me at camp.
187.context: NodeContext: Astarion speaking to the companion origin character that's replacing him in the party. "Them" refers to the player's avatar characer.

141.speaker: Wyll
141.text: A splendid plan. We'll talk more there.

58.speaker: Player
58.context: NodeContext: Astarion speaking to the companion origin character that's replacing him in the party. "Them" refers to the player's avatar characer.

32.speaker: Player
32.text: Take Astarion's place - he can head back to camp.
32.context: NodeContext: Astarion speaking to the companion origin character that's replacing him in the party. "Them" refers to the player's avatar characer.

23.speaker: Narrator
23.text: *Your companion is otherwise engaged. You'll need to dismiss them at a more convenient moment.*
23.context: NodeContext: Astarion speaking to the companion origin character that's replacing him in the party. "Them" refers to the player's avatar characer.

259.speaker: Narrator
259.text: *Your companion is otherwise engaged. You'll need to dismiss them at a more convenient moment.*

192.speaker: Player
192.text: If I must. But do try to keep them safe - they're a little useless without me.
192.context: NodeContext: Astarion speaking to the companion origin character that's replacing him in the party. "Them" refers to the player's avatar characer.

194.speaker: Astarion
194.text: I would object, but sitting by the fire while you do all the hard work sounds marvellous, actually.
194.context: NodeContext: Astarion speaking to the companion origin character that's replacing him in the party. "Them" refers to the player's avatar characer.

176.speaker: Player
176.text: Gale could do with a rest.
176.context: NodeContext: Well. I know when I'm not wanted. - not shitty, just gentle faux haughtiness

172.speaker: Narrator
172.text: I'll get little rest given the stack of unread books waiting for me - but I'll try.

171.speaker: Player
171.text: I'll get little rest given the stack of unread books waiting for me - but I'll try.

21.speaker: Gale
21.text: Keeping your greatest weapon in reserve, eh? An excellent strategy.

26.speaker: Player
26.context: NodeContext: Well. I know when I'm not wanted. - not shitty, just gentle faux haughtiness

153.speaker: Narrator
153.context: NodeContext: Well. I know when I'm not wanted. - not shitty, just gentle faux haughtiness

256.speaker: Player
256.context: NodeContext: Well. I know when I'm not wanted. - not shitty, just gentle faux haughtiness

185.speaker: Jaheira
185.text: Well. I know when I'm not wanted.
185.context: NodeContext: Well. I know when I'm not wanted. - not shitty, just gentle faux haughtiness

269.speaker: Narrator
269.text: Fine. I shall wait in our camp.

94.speaker: Player
94.text: Fine. I shall wait in our camp.

190.speaker: Shadowheart
190.text: If you insist. Don't have all the fun without me.

169.speaker: Narrator
169.text: I shall remain at camp for now.

36.speaker: Player
36.text: I shall remain at camp for now.

86.speaker: Halsin
86.text: I shall be waiting. Come find me when you need me.

243.speaker: Narrator
243.text: Who would I be to question your wisdom?

145.speaker: Player
145.text: Who would I be to question your wisdom?

133.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
133.text: I will wait in camp. Patiently, even.

51.speaker: Wyll
51.text: I like your thinking. Besides, I watched you fight at the gate. I could use an ally like you.

93.speaker: Wyll
93.text: An excellent suggestion - but your party's full up.

25.speaker: Wyll
25.text: Still - when the time comes, call for the Blade. I won't be long to answer.

156.speaker: Player
156.text: Go to my camp and wait for me.

38.speaker: Player
38.text: I can help you hunt that devil of yours.

147.speaker: Player
147.text: Chk. A tadpole feasts on our skulls, and you're signing on to chase devils?

154.speaker: Lae'zel
154.text: Chk. A tadpole feasts on our skulls, and you're signing on to chase devils?

108.speaker: Player
108.text: Good luck with your devil problem - it seems your work's cut out for you.

61.speaker: Wyll
61.text: Well met - and call on me if you find a fix for this affliction of ours. Might even join you once that devil's met my blade.

42.speaker: Player
42.text: I met a group of paladins who were also seeking this devil.

98.speaker: Wyll
98.text: I'm not surprised. My target is well-known for her brutality in service of her evil mistress.

276.speaker: Wyll
276.text: Her name is Karlach. An archdevil's soldier I swore on my good eye to kill.

63.speaker: Player
63.text: Hunting in the Hells. Dangerous territory.

280.speaker: Wyll
280.text: I'm no stranger to the infernal. Better to slay a devil before her fires burn common folk to ash.

80.speaker: Player
80.text: Cavorting with devils, I see. You should consider better company.

275.speaker: Wyll
275.text: A fiend makes for poor company - unless it's been stuffed and mounted on your wall.

55.speaker: Player
55.text: A Devil's Advocate. Do you think she'll bring the Blood War to Faerûn?

130.speaker: Wyll
130.text: That ship's sailed the Styx already. All I can hope for's to limit the damage.

204.speaker: Player
204.text: Who was that woman, the one in your thoughts?

148.speaker: Wyll
148.text: You saw her, then. Advocatus diaboli.

150.speaker: Narrator
150.text: *You see the fiend again, and ignite with Wyll's rancour. She is an infernal wardevil, a threat to the living - evil incarnate.*

46.speaker: Wyll
46.text: Shit - you saw her: advocatus diaboli.

131.speaker: Player
131.text: I'm more concerned about the parasite. I suggest we search for a healer together.

111.text: I'm more concerned about the parasite. I suggest we search for a healer together.

64.speaker: Player
64.text: I'm more concerned about the parasite. I suggest we search for a healer together.

103.speaker: Player
103.text: This whelp is hopeless. You're wasting your time.
103.context: NodeContext: Wyll holding is holding a sword with his RIGHT hand.

0.speaker: Wyll
0.text: Ignore them, Umi. Go on, now - practise what you've learned.
0.context: NodeContext: Wyll holding is holding a sword with his RIGHT hand.

126.speaker: Player
126.text: It's good advice, child. You'd do well to listen.
126.context: NodeContext: Wyll holding is holding a sword with his RIGHT hand.

17.speaker: Wyll
17.text: You're on the right path, Umi. Go on, now - practise what you've learned.
17.context: NodeContext: Wyll holding is holding a sword with his RIGHT hand.

37.speaker: Player
37.text: Heed the man's words, child. His form is highly efficient.
37.context: NodeContext: Wyll holding is holding a sword with his RIGHT hand.

90.speaker: Wyll
90.text: Kind words in unkind times, my friend.
90.context: NodeContext: Wyll holding is holding a sword with his RIGHT hand.

283.speaker: Player
283.text: Enough snivelling, child. Your enemies will not be swayed by tears.

160.speaker: Wyll
160.text: You are the company you keep. And you have chosen poor company.

166.speaker: Narrator
166.text: *The man's smile bends downward, and his thoughts become yours.*

181.speaker: Wyll
181.text: The Blade of Frontiers, at your calling.

89.speaker: Player
89.text: Come on. I think it's time we go on a devil hunt.

210.speaker: Player
210.text: I'd like to join up and find a cure for this parasite of ours.

174.speaker: Player
174.text: Go and wait for me in camp.

257.speaker: Wyll
257.text: I will find you, Karlach. And you will meet my blade.
